name: deplorably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is very bad and deserves strong disapproval: He behaved deplorably. the deplorably low standards of today’s journalists See
deplorable
More examplesFewer examplesThe government must accept responsibility for the deplorably high level of unemployment.Deplorably, the Administration's foreign policy in the Middle East region has relied on sloganeering.People are treated deplorably in the detention centre.
